title: Elements of a Formula
description: Formulas may include field references, operators, functions, literal values, global variables, or custom Apex classes. You can combine these elements to create effective formulas.

elements.description: A fixed text or numeric value you enter directly into a formula. For example, the formula ROUND((Amount * 0.02), 2) includes a literal numeric value of 0.02.

A reference to another field's value using merge fields. Use field_name for standard fields, field_name__c for custom fields, or object_name__r.field_name for related objects. Field references are case-sensitive.
Built-in variables available for field mappings, such as $User.Id, $User.UserName, $User.Email, and $User.ProfileId.

Predefined operations that accept input and return a result. For example, TODAY() returns the current date without needing input, whereas TEXT(value) converts numbers, percents, or currency into text.
Symbols indicating calculation type or evaluation order, such as + for addition or parentheses ( ) to prioritize expressions.
Custom Apex classes implementing the pushtopics.TargetValueMapper interface for advanced transformations. Reference the class using the format {!apexClassName}.
